intro: Boehmeria moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its fibrous stems have been used traditionally for making textiles and paper.
